sub_title: Double Degree student Wageningen University & Research / SMEA - Alta Scuola di Management & Economia Agro-Alimentare
summary:
I have always been passionate about the Agrifood sector. Its increasingly complex and international character was only one of the reasons I recently, after over four years at Wageningen University, decided to move to Italy to obtain my Double Degree. This experience will allow me to look at the Agrifood sector from a different perspective and hopefully, in the future, to help in addressing the challenges lying ahead.

My colleagues at university describe me as a trustworthy, flexible and highly motivated person with an eye for detail. An important part of my job as a private teacher has been to motivate other people, to determine the optimal (personalized) strategy to improve results. 

I am used to do projects in an international context/team, and I would consider myself equally fluent in English and Dutch, written as well as spoken. Thanks to these projects I was able to directly work with and consult companies in the Agri-Food domain (Vitelia Voeders BV, Oost NL) interested in exploring new business opportunities. As some projects had a strong interdisciplinary character, I also learned to work together with people from different fields. 

I have experience in working independently as well and my Bachelor thesis was graded 8 out of 10. Finally, I possess a solid academic background in Management Studies, mostly related to food and agriculture but also in more general terms.

projects:
[{'title': 'Oost NL - Exploring the future scenario of the Dutch AgriTech industry following the execution of JEFTA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': "During the Master course ''Academic Consultancy Training'' Oost NL, a regional business development and investment agency, assigned the team to analyze to what extent the EU-Japan trade agreement (JEFTA) would create new business opportunities for companies in East Netherlands. The group investigated the willingness of Dutch AgriTech SMEs to establish new business relationships with Japanese companies as well as their expectations. 

Role: 
Secretary of the team

Tasks: 
Correspondence and public relations, conducting interviews with executives, final presentation of findings at headquarters Oost NL, Apeldoorn, the Netherlands

Accomplishments:
A Japan Business Day organized by the commissioner
